result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mballing C Colley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom
Original (Plea Hearing 4/15/2014) filed

ADDRESS INFO for Mballing C Colley
Current: 6813 Park Edge Dr, Madison, WI 53719 United States  (Effective: 02-29-2016)
Prior: 7549 Carrington Dr Apt E, Madison, WI 53719
set over ASH to follow what happens in 14CF957

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not threaten nor direct any acts of violence toward MB, d.o.b. 01/17/1999.
- The Court finds sustantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
- Defendant shall not threaten to send the minor child to Africa or out of the United States.
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of the Court.
- Defendant shall not engage in physical discipline of any child.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of guilty on count 1.  Counts 2,3 and 4 were dismissed and read in. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.
from counsel, cancel FPT. Schedule PLEAH asap.  granted.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:59
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney David L Mandell.  Robert J. Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with M.B. or Maimuna B.
- The Court finds sustantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
- Defendant shall not threaten to send the minor child to Africa or out of the United States.
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of the Court.
- Defendant shall not engage in physical discipline of any child.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12

Defendant in court with Attorney David L Mandell.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
